page.title: 01Kingston & Bourn villages
page.content: This block of land is rural, with a small population concentrated in the villages of Kington and Bourn. The village I toft is partly in the eastern edge of the block. There are a few houses in the countryside between the two villages. Kingston has many very old, ofter thatched cottages and no modern housing estate. Thus, there are large gardens, orchards and fields in this village which is unusual so near a large city. Bourn is larger with several new housing estates, and also a school, doctor, two pubs, two shops and a post ofice which Kingston Lacks. Kingston children go by bus to school in Bourn (primary) or Comberton (secondary) and some go to private schools in Cambridge. There are two farms in kingston (Payne's and Town farm) and five in Born. These are mostly large arable farms producing
